==Overview==
'''Heroes For Hire, Inc.''' is a small business licensed by the state of New York which offered a full line of professional investigation and protection services. Heroes For Hire was owned by [[Luke Cage (Earth-616)|Luke Cage]] and [[Daniel Thomas Rand-K'ai (Earth-616)|Daniel Rand]]. It had offices on [[Park Avenue]] and two paid employees, secretary [[Jennifer Royce (Earth-616)|Jennie Royce]] and lawyer/business representative, [[Jeryn Hogarth (Earth-616)|Jeryn Hogarth]]. Heroes For Hire would not accept jobs involving extralegal activities.{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist Vol 1 54}} 

==Origin==
They first met at a party held by Jeryn celebrating Luke Cage's exoneration of all charges they were attacked by [[Thomas Stuart (Earth-616)|Stiletto]] and [[Timothy Stuart (Earth-616)|Discus]] teaming up to take them down.{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist Vol 1 50}} Cage's efforts led to a fight with Iron Fist, however, upon learning of Cage's situation, Danny later helped him defeat [[Tilda Johnson (Earth-616)|Nightshade]].{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist Vol 1 #51|52}} Cleared of criminal charges, they briefly worked for [[Mercedes Knight (Earth-616)|Misty Knight]]'s detective agency [[Daughters of the Dragon (Earth-616)|Nightwing Restorations]] but soon elected to become a two-man team, "Heroes for Hire". Although the streetwise Cage and the unworldly Iron Fist seemed to have little in common, they soon became the best of friends.{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist Vol 1 53}}

==Heroes for Hire==
[[File:Power Man and Iron Fist Vol 3 1 Classic Variant Textless.jpg|right|thumb|300px]]
Danny visited [[Joy Meachum (Earth-616)|Joy Meachum]] and relinquished control of his share of [[Rand Corporation (Earth-616)|Rand-Meachum Inc.]] to her until such a time that he believed he's earned the wealth from the company. Their first official mission as a team was against the [[Incinerator (Earth-616)|Incinerator]] who tried to rob Manhattan National Bank. They took him down easily using the sprinkler system, then Cage just knocked him out.{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #54}} They next attended a local car show to advertise the business, which Cage found boring until it was attacked by the [[Bull (Criminal) (Earth-616)|Bull]] and his thugs. Their mission was to steal the [[Fantasti-Car MK II|Fantasti-Car]] which was on display at the show. The duo took out the thugs with little effort.{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #55}}

==Living Monolith==
The were hired by [[Ahmet Abdol (Earth-616)|Ahmet Abdol]] and Professor Merridew to protect an exhibit of ancient Egyptian artifacts on display at the Metropolitan Museum. [[Jaime Garcia (Earth-616)|Senor Suerte]] tried to rob the museum and they initially stopped him but the artifacts they recovered were revealed to be fakes. Teaming up with [[Rafael Scarfe (Earth-616)|Lt. Rafael Scarfe]] of the [[New York City Police Department (Earth-616)|N.Y.P.D.]] they followed a lead and ended up at the apartment of Ahmet Abdol who was revealed to be the "Living Monolith".{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #56}} The Monolith then began a rampage on the city and the pair teamed up with Misty, [[Colleen Wing (Earth-616)|Colleen Wing]] and the [[X-Men (Earth-616)|X-Men]] to stop him. They learned that he was empowered by the Cheops Crystal, which was stealing life energy from people. They freed the imprisoned people and the Monolith returned to normal.{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #57}}

==El Aguila==
The duo tried to take down [[Alejandro Montoya (Earth-616)|El Aguila]], a "hero for the underprivileged", who was taking on drug dealers and crime lords with a sword. J.P. Preston, the owner of the London Street Property Owners Association (who owned local slum housing), hired the team to stop El Aguila, who had been robbing his offices. They reluctantly accepted and when they confronted El Aguila, Preston tried to shoot him but Cage got in the way and he escaped. Preston screamed at them to stop him but they reminded him that they got paid a retainer regardless of success or failure and that since it was after 5:00 their shift was over and they left.{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #58}}

==Manhattan Bomber==
The incident with J.P. Preston gave them bad press appearing in an article in the [[Daily Bugle (The DB!) (Earth-616)|Daily Bugle]]. Danny was injured in an explosion and [[Alan Cavenaugh (Earth-616)|Alan Cavenaugh]] was the main suspect.{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #59}} He was taken to the police under suspicion that he was the "Manhattan Bomber" because of Cavenaugh's past ties with the IRA. They were hired by the ambassador to [[Halwan]], who offered them $1000 to determine who the bomber was. During the investigation they proved his innocence and Alan helped them find the bomb before it blew up the embassy.{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #60}}

==Maggia==
[[Benjamin Donovan (Earth-616)|Big Ben Donovan]] came to them for help after being attacked by goons of the [[Maggia (Earth-616)|Maggia]]. However they were led by [[Michael Marko (Earth-616)|Man Mountain Marko]] who knocked Cage into some exposed electrical wire. [[William Carver (Earth-616)|Thunderbolt]] was also following Donavan as a suspect in  a murder case and believed Iron Fist was just another thug but after a brief battle they realized their mistake. Cage and Donovan were taken to  [[Caesar Cicero (Earth-616)|Caesar Cicero]], who wanted to know the location of the stolen drugs. {{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #61}} They tracked down Cicero's penthouse, but Cage was taken to a graveyard to be buried alive. They found the grave and rescued their friend, but Donovan revealed that he kept the drugs for himself and ordered the hit on Thunderbolt's brother. Having found his brother's killer, Thunderbolt died happy, leaving them to turn in Donovan.{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #62}}

==Senor Suerte/Senor Muerte==
They smashed up a number of [[Jaime Garcia (Earth-616)|Senor Suerte]]'s gambling operations, who now wanted revenge for the death of his brother. This gained them a lot of popularity regarding their latest case. Suerte placed a bomb in the [[Gem Theater]], destroying the building and injuring [[David Griffith (Earth-616)|D.W. Griffith]].{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #63}} The heroes tracked down Senor Suerte and [[Phillip Garcia (Earth-616)|Senor Muerte]] and as they were arrested they swore to get revenge.{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #64}}

==Visit to Canada==
The team was called to Canada where they visited Jeryn's private office. He brought them there as women on his staff may have been stealing the various assets that are kept at the Aerie. When El Aguila arrived to attack the Aerie, he ultimately ends up teaming up with the Heroes for Hire, and exposing a number of Jeryn's support staff who are responsible.{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #65}}
 
==Sabretooth & Constrictor==
When Misty and Colleen were injured in a fight against [[Victor Creed (Earth-616)|Sabretooth]] and the [[Frank Payne (Earth-616)|Constrictor]], they asked the Heroes for Hire for help. They took down the criminals and rescued Misty whose bionic arm was trapped in a vault.{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #66}}

==Bushmaster==
Luke was kidnapped when they were breaking up a bank robbery. They later found out he was captured by his old foe [[John McIver (Earth-616)|Bushmaster]]. He wanted [[Noah Burstein (Earth-616)|Dr. Noah Burstein]] to reverse the process that slowly rends him immobile. He did this by holding his wife hostage. Danny tracked him to his lab on a ship. Danny freed Luke, and before Bushmaster could push the button to signal to his men to kill Noah's wife, he became totally inert. As Bushmaster's body crumbled into a skeleton the others escaped.{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #67}} After the incident Luke had lost his super-powers. But they still needed to rescue Emma Burstein, but in his weakened state Luke was left back at the office to recover. [[Arthur Nagan (Earth-616)|Dr. Arthur Nagan]] came after Luke for revenge after his defeat by him and the [[Defenders (Earth-616)|Defenders]]. Luke escaped to find his friends, but Nagan followed. During a fight Luke is knocked into the electric fence. However, instead of killing him the electricity restores his super-powers, allowing to take down Nagan with ease.{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #68}}
<!--
===Colonel Eschat===
Nathaniel Turner, a former soldier of fortune, came to the Heroes for Hire for protection. They were all targeted by Colonel Eschat, who was seeking to kill them so that he cannot be identified.  When all are dead, Eschat went after the real target he was hired to kill: District Attorney [[Blake Tower (Earth-616)|Blake Tower]], however they arrived just in time to save him.{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #69}}-->

==Supremo==
They were hired by [[Supremo (Earth-616)|El Supremo]], the leader of  [[Terranueva]], to stop a drug operation. But during the investigation they learn he is a dictator and running the drug operations himself. With the help of the locals they overthrew the despot leader. {{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #70}}
<!--
===Montenegro===
[[Montenegro (Earth-616)|Montenegro]] and Luke originally crossed paths when Cage took a quarter that belonged to Montenegro.  The quarter contained within it an experimental micro-chip.{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #71}}

===Golden Tigers===
[[William Hao (Earth-616)|William Hao]] asked them for help against the [[Golden Tigers (Earth-616)|Golden Tigers]] led by  [[Thomas Arn (Earth-616)|Chaka]].  Danny enrolled in a  number of marital arts classes to try and see if one of the teachers is really Chaka.  After one class Danny was attacked and Chaka identity as Thomas Arn a teacher at one of the martial arts schools was revealed.
{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #72}}

===Dire Wraiths===
[[Rom (Earth-616)|ROM the Spaceknight]] has come to [[Earth]] in search of [[Dire Wraiths]]. [[Solace (Earth-616)|Solace]] the Heroes for Hire to find Rom. but after a brief fight the truth of the Dire Wraiths is revealed helping the hero on his mission.{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #73}} -->

==Master Khan==
The [[Ninja (Master Khan) (Earth-616)|Ninja]] stole the [[Amulets of Power]] worn by the [[Sons of the Tiger (Earth-616)|Sons of the Tiger]], beating [[Robert Diamond (Earth-616)|Bob Diamond]] half to death in the process. Luke and Danny went to check on their friend in hospital where the learn [[Khan (Earth-616)|Master Khan]] had sent the Ninja to recover the Amulets.  However when they find the antique shop he is hiding in he releases a mystical Jade Tiger.  He leapt on it's back as it took him through a portal.{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #74}} They follow  and found themselves in K'un-Lun. They help them against an attack from the plant like [[H'ylthri]]. Danny is attacked by [[Nu-An (Earth-616)|Yu-Ti]] and taken to be sacrificed to  Master Khan. [[Lei-Kung (Earth-616)|Lei-Kung]] and Luke came to his rescue. Khan opened a portal back to Earth, but before they leave, Iron Fist destroys the crystal that works as a bridge between the two realms.{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #75}}
<!-- ===Other Missions===
They earned an an international reputation and fighting a wide variety of criminals, including [[Mitchell Tanner (Earth-616)|Warhawk]]{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #76}}[[Ninotchka (Earth-616)|Ninotchka]]{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #77}}. The Slasher{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #78}}, [[Incinerators (Earth-616)|The Dredlox]].{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #79}} However a few of these came back for revenge such as Montenegro{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #80}}, Ninotchka{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #81|82}}, Warhawk{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #83}}, Sabretooth and Constrictor{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #70|84}} 

They continued on against; [[Harvey Elder (Earth-616)|Mole Man]]{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #85}}, [[Goldeneye (Earth-616)|Goldeneye]]{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #86}}, [[Donald Planet (Earth-616)|Commodore Planet]]{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #87}} [[Scimitar (Earth-616)|Scimitar]], [[Black Mariah]]{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #88}} [[Hosiah Hawkins (Earth-616)|Major Hawkins]]{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #89}}, [[Gunther Bain (Earth-616)|Unus the Untouchable]]{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #90}} and [[Stoneface (Earth-616)|Stoneface]] {{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #91}} -->
==Hammerhead==
[[Michael Marko (Earth-616)|Man Mountain Marko]] was sent to free [[Hammerhead (Joseph) (Earth-616)|Hammerhead]] from a prison transport protected by the Heroes for Hire. Marko along with the [[Edward Lavell (Earth-616)|Eel]]  are easily matched against the heroes. However Luke and Danny trade partners, pitting the Eel against Luke, and Man Mountain against Iron Fist, the Heroes for Hire manage to beat their foes. Hammerhead crashed into the prison wall and was arrested.{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist Vol 1 92}}

===Other Threats===
They later take on villains such as [[Impasse (Earth-616)|Impasse]]{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist Vol 1 101}}, [[Doombringer (Earth-616)|Doombringer]] {{r|Power Man and Iron Fist Vol 1 #102|104}}, [[Thomas Ewing (Earth-616)|Firefly]] {{r|Power Man and Iron Fist Vol 1 105}},  [[David Cannon (Earth-616)|Whirlwind]]{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist Vol 1 106}}, [[Victor Kreeger (Earth-616)|Hammer of Judgment]]{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist Vol 1 107}}, [[Anthony Sloan (Earth-616)|Firebolt]]{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist Vol 1 108}},  [[Louis Dawson (Earth-616)|The Reaper]].{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist Vol 1 109}}

===Millie Hogarth===
Luke and Danny escort Jeryn Hogarth's beautiful daughter [[Millicent Hogarth (Earth-616)|Millie Hogarth]] to her first debutante's ball! But amid the glamor and glitter we find [[Nightshade]], [[Stiletto]], [[Discus]], [[Man Mountain Marko]], and the [[Eel]].{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist Vol 1 110}} -->
==Captain Hero==
Luke was attacked by [[Kl'rt (Earth-616)|Captain Hero]], who wanted him as his "partner". Luke refused and Captain Hero eventually knocked Luke through a building which fell on top of him. Luke recovered but swore revenge. [[Character Index/W#Dr. West|Dr. West]] approached them and explained  Captain Hero was actually a small child who was exposed to alien radiation and gained great power. They took him down and he was sent to [[Project P.E.G.A.S.U.S.]] for treatment.{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist Vol 1 111}}

==Disbandment==
Their partnership's downfall began when the mysterious government agency [[Strategic Military Intelligence Law-Enforcement Division (Earth-616)|S.M.I.L.E.]] manipulated Cage and Iron Fist into the employment of [[Consolidated Conglomerates, Inc. (Earth-616)|Consolidated Conglomerates, Inc.]].{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #112|115}} During their first CCI assignment, Iron Fist contracted radiation poisoning.{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #116|117}} Cage took him to K'un-Lun for treatment.{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #118}}

[[File:Iron Fist (H'ylthri) (Earth-616) from Power Man and Iron Fist Vol 1 119 0001.jpg|thumb|right|150px|Iron Fist doppelgänger]]
While there, Iron Fist was, unknown to Cage, replaced by a [[Daniel Rand (H'ylthri) (Earth-616)|doppelgänger]] of the plantlike [[H'ylthri]] race, K'un-Lun's ancient enemies.{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #119}} Luke did not suspect anything, putting "Danny"'s strange behavior down to recovering from his poisoning.{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #120|124}} Soon after their return to the outside world, the doppelgänger was destroyed, pummelled by the alien [[Kl'rt (Earth-616)|Super-Skrull]], as a result of a bizarre scheme engineered by Iron Fist's archenemy, [[Khan (Earth-616)|Master Khan]]. Cage was blamed for the apparent murder of Iron Fist.{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist #125}}
<!-- ===Oracle Inc. Team===
As a consequence of [[Onslaught (Psychic Entity) (Earth-616)|Onslaught's]] apparent [[Onslaught (Event)|apparent massacre]] of several heroes, New York suffered a power vacuum. [[Oracle Inc. (Earth-616)|Oracle Inc.]] sponsored a new [[Heroes for Hire (Oracle Inc.) (Earth-616)|Heroes for Hire]]. {{r|Heroes for Hire Vol 1 1}} But is eventually disbanded.{{r|Heroes for Hire Vol 1 19}}

===Knight & Wings Team===
During the [[Civil War]]; [[Mercedes Knight (Earth-616)|Misty Knight]] and [[Colleen Wing (Earth-616)|Colleen Wing]] were asked to form their own [[Heroes for Hire (Knight & Wing) (Earth-616)|Heroes for Hire]] which corresponded to the [[Superhuman Registration Act]].{{r|Heroes for Hire Vol 2 1}} The team eventually disbanded.{{r|Villains for Hire Vol 1 0.1}} -->
==Original Team==
[[File:Power Man and Iron Fist Vol 2 4 Textless.jpg|thumb|left|150px|The new Power Man and Iron Fist]]
Luke and the real Danny later reformed the original Heroes for Hire during [[Shadowland|Daredevil's takeover of Hell's Kitchen]]. They recruited [[Víctor Álvarez (Earth-616)|Víctor Álvarez]] the as the new Power Man.{{r|Shadowland: Power Man Vol 1 2}} Danny took Victor under his wing and helped the young hero with his training. The new duo helped Jennie Royce when she was accused of murder.{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist Vol 2 #1|5}} They later recruited [[Ava Ayala (Earth-616)|Ava Ayala]] the new White Tiger. The Heroes for Hire teamed with Spider-Man to battle the [[Parnival Plunder (Earth-616)|Plunderer]] when he attempted to steal [[Horizon Labs (Earth-616)|Horizon Labs]] technology. The team disbanded not long after as the members joined the [[Mighty Avengers (Cage) (Earth-616)|Mighty Avengers]].{{r|Mighty Avengers Vol 2 1}}

==Misappropriated==
[[File:Power Man and Iron Fist Vol 3 10 Textless.jpg|thumb]]
During the lull in usage, [[Wade Wilson (Earth-616)|Deadpool]] took hold of the Heroes for Hire name after he became inspired by [[James Bourne (Earth-616)|Solo]]'s usage of his image. This angered Luke Cage into getting the name back, thanks to a cease and desist letter proclaiming rights usage.{{r|Deadpool Vol 6 1}}

After helping [[Lonnie Lincoln (Earth-616)|Tombstone]] recover the [[Supersoul Stone]] from White Jennie,{{r|Power Man and Iron Fist Vol 3 #1|4}} Luke and Danny then reunited once again as the Heroes for Hire, opening a [[Headquarters of the Heroes for Hire|new headquarters]] in [[Harlem]]. They next accompanied Deadpool and [[Matthew Murdock (Earth-616)|Daredevil]] to [[Fresh Kills]], [[New Jersey (State)|New Jersey]] to recover a missing laptop.{{r|Deadpool Vol 6 13}}
